name: The Schoolhouse at Dornie

reviews.text: Our second perfect stay at The Schoolhouse, again with a group of two ( one French, one Franco-Scottish) families. Fantastic accommodation : spotlessly clean and comfortable as they come. Decoration is bright and understated, which is a refreshing change from many B&Bs: not a hint of chintz, satin or twee 'Scottish'. Some great books in the hallway too.
reviews.title: Perfect !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful views from all rooms and extra bonus of having a self-catering kitchen with everything you need for a 'continental' breakfast already supplied. Lovely idea to have pancakes for the breakfast and Tunnocks' Caramel Wafers sitting out when we arrived.
reviews.title: An amazing find within walking distance of Eilean Donan Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course, you can also use the kitchen to cook your meals in if you choose to do so- there are two separate hobs, which means you don't get in the way of other guests( there are 4 rooms in all) , but this time round our host, Mary, actually made a booking for us up in the Plockton Inn where we had an excellent meal (the freshest seafood including huge scallops) and then stayed on a while for the music in the bar (child friendly).
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you will have guessed from this review, I cannot say enough good things about The Schoolhouse and would definitely go straight back there the next time I'm up in Dornie. It is absolutely the perfect place for those who want something between self-catering and B&B.
reviews.title: A charming wee Scottish gem, and incredibly affordable.
A wonderful alternative
reviews.text: A huge thank you once again to Mary for her fantastic welcome.

aka: The Schoolhouse At Dornie Hotel Dornie
